rename.from: VirtualBox: Vagrant does not recover if master VM for linked clones for linked clones is deleted
rename.to: VirtualBox: Vagrant does not recover if master VM for linked clones is deleted

body:
Just encountered exactly the same issue. ID of your master VM is stored in `~/.vagrant.d/boxes/<box
_name>/<box_version>/virtualbox/master_id`. Once this file is removed `vagrant up` will work as expected again, however this issue should be addressed somehow in Vagrant itself.

`vagrant destroy` doesn't remove the master VM automatically and, as you've pointed out, the only way to get rid of it is a manual action. With this in mind, I think that Vagrant should fallback to regular import if master VM cannot be found.

Thanks. 
The workaround worked just fine and now i'm using linked clones again.

If you agree, I leave this issue open as a reminder for implementing "fallback to regular import if master VM cannot be found."

This is also a problem if you repackage a box that is attached to a linked clone. The master_id file will be packaged into the new box, which causes it to be initially unusable for other users who add the box.
Should there a way to force it to pull a new master vm via attribute or something similar to give you control when an update has been made?

Hi @fabriziopandini 

I think falling back to a regular import if the clone does not exist makes sense (provided we also output this via the UI message). However, please note that the following is really outside of Vagrant's domain:

> manually delete master VM for linked clones in virtual box

Changes that occur to a VM's lifecycle outside of Vagrant are impossible for Vagrant to manage.
@sethvargo What about a kitchen destroy action or kitchen pre_create_command to remove clone master?

Hi @lgeinert 

I'm not sure how Test Kitchen is involved in this context.
Just hit this when playing with otto. Took me about half an hour to analyze where this is coming from.

issue.title: Fixed linked clone failure when master VM is missing

repository.name: vagrant
repository.description: Vagrant is a tool for building and distributing development environments.

issue.body:
### Overview

When using linked_clones, If the master VM is manually removed from VirtualBox a user will get a Box with UUID xxx-xxx-xxx Not Found error when trying to run `vagrant up` on a new machine.

This is because the master_id file exists `action/import_master.rb` sets `env[:clone_id] = master_id_file.read.chomp if master_id_file.file?`

The `action/import.rb` code assumes if `env[:clone_id]` is set then it does not need to import the box, it can just clone it.  This is not true when the master VM has manually been removed.

The `action/import_master.rb` code  seemed to be setup to handle this situation with a nice `if` statement.  All the if statement did though was log a message.

```
          if env[:clone_id] && env[:machine].provider.driver.vm_exists?(env[:clone_id])
            @logger.info(
              "Master VM for '#{env[:machine].box.name}' already exists " +
              " (id=#{env[:clone_id]}) - skipping import step.")
            return
          end
```

This pull request just adds an `else` to this `if` statement to remove the `env[:clone_id]` setting so that when `action/import.rb` is called it knows it needs to first import the master, then clone.

Fixes #6742

issue.title: There was an error while executing `VBoxManage`, a CLI used by Vagrant for controlling VirtualBox. The command and stderr is shown below.  Command: ["clonevm", "72c93322-9bb9-4d27-a29b-ed8cf047e370", "--register", "--name", "temp_clone_1461368679947_13656"]

repository.name: netplugin
repository.description: Container networking for various use cases

issue.body:
Error while following steps from here : 
https://github.com/contiv/netplugin/blob/master/docs/DevEnv.md
When you do make start in step 2.

Error : 
There was an error while executing `VBoxManage`, a CLI used by Vagrant
for controlling VirtualBox. The command and stderr is shown below.

Command: ["clonevm", "72c93322-9bb9-4d27-a29b-ed8cf047e370", "--register", "--name", "temp_clone_1461368679947_13656"]

Stderr: VBoxManage: error: Could not find a registered machine with UUID {72c93322-9bb9-4d27-a29b-ed8cf047e370}
VBoxManage: error: Details: code VBOX_E_OBJECT_NOT_FOUND (0x80bb0001), component VirtualBoxWrap, interface IVirtualBox, callee nsISupports
VBoxManage: error: Context: "FindMachine(Bstr(pszSrcName).raw(), srcMachine.asOutParam())" at line 431 of file VBoxManageMisc.cpp

contiv/netplugin
netplugin - Container networking for various use cases

issue.title: `vagrant up` fails on Cloning VM step if machine with registered UUID cannot be found
issue.body:
Using DrupalVM version 2.3.0 and higher, I'm getting the error below when running `vagrant up`; apparently related to the change made in PR #400.  

The [Vagrant docs for that option](https://www.vagrantup.com/docs/virtualbox/configuration.html) state that it "Linked clones are based on a master VM, which is generated by importing the base box only once the first time it is required." so apparently somewhere in my setup there's a pointer stored to the vm that it's trying to clone, but I have yet to be able to locate it.

> $ vagrant up
> Bringing machine 'drupalvm' up with 'virtualbox' provider...
> ==> drupalvm: Preparing master VM for linked clones...
>     drupalvm: This is a one time operation. Once the master VM is prepared,
>     drupalvm: it will be used as a base for linked clones, making the creation
>     drupalvm: of new VMs take milliseconds on a modern system.
> ==> drupalvm: Cloning VM...
> There was an error while executing `VBoxManage`, a CLI used by Vagrant
> for controlling VirtualBox. The command and stderr is shown below.
> 
> Command: ["clonevm", "cc0ea946-b120-41bc-bd7e-ea6779a7be04", "--register", "--name", "temp_clone_1456752692208_35054"]
> 
> Stderr: VBoxManage: error: Could not find a registered machine with UUID {cc0ea946-b120-41bc-bd7e-ea6779a7be04}
> VBoxManage: error: Details: code VBOX_E_OBJECT_NOT_FOUND (0x80bb0001), component VirtualBoxWrap, interface IVirtualBox, callee nsISupports
> VBoxManage: error: Context: "FindMachine(Bstr(pszSrcName).raw(), srcMachine.asOutParam())" at line 431 of file VBoxManageMisc.cpp

body: Why not to add option to vagrant destroy to destroy also link to master? Avoiding job of finding thread with this discussion and manually running shell command :) or to vagrant up to ask recreate master if it does not exists.
